subject: Re: [junit]
msgSnippet: ... It sounds like you have a set of test data and a resulting image that you know is correct. Your test could check to see if future results match that first
messageBody:
"David V. Olivier" <dolivier@...> wrote:
> I am currently implementing functionality to warp satellite images from one
> mapping projection to another. The image is distorted according to a
> complex formula. On a low level, I can test that for a given input my
> implementation of the formula provides the result I expect, but on a higher
> level I haven't been able to automate verification of that the final image
> is correct. I have only been able to superimpose the result on a
> background map I know is correct and eyeball the results.

It sounds like you have a set of test data and a resulting image that you know
is correct. Your test could check to see if future results match that first
result image (by comparing all the pixels or something).


> David Olivier
> Naval Research Laboratory
> Digital Mapping, Charting & Geodesy Analysis Program

Hey, I used to work for the National Geodetic Survey. Never thought I'd ever
see the word "geodesy" again... :)


Erik
